title: meta
content:
Welcome to Technomancy

My name is Phil Hagelberg, and I am a Free Software hacker*.

I believe that the combination of the Internet and the precepts expressed in the GNU General Public License** has given rise to a distributed development model capable of delivering superior software and establishing a vibrant community of creative, collaborating programmers. My goal as a developer is to harness this power for my employers and contribute the fruits of my effort back to the community that allowed me to do it in the first place.

* Hacker: A person who enjoys exploring the details of programmable systems and how to stretch their capabilities, as opposed to most users, who prefer to learn only the minimum necessary. Not to be confused with the term 'cracker': A malicious meddler who tries to discover sensitive information by poking around. For more information, see The Hacker FAQ.

** I don't mean to say that I prefer the GPL to other software licenses for everything I write--merely that the GPL is the license that expresses most clearly the sharing spirit of intellectual community.

Note that the word 'Technomancy' is a neologism of my own which is has no connection to either literal magick or the diabolical arts.
